pullrequest.title: Use variables to control auto generation of CFlags

content.raw:
Seems like a nice enhancement.
Warning thus should be always enabled if they are supported by the compiler. See for instance:
https://github.com/jrl-umi3218/jrl-cmakemodules/blob/master/compiler.cmake
I use the CheckCXXCompilerFlag module to enable as much warning as possible.
It avoids having different set of warnings depending on your profile while supporting compilation with compiler you don't intend to try (say the Intel Compiler for instance).
